title: Welcome to Moxie 2.0
body:
Here it is: the new Moxie Online Experience, version TWO POINT OH! Feel free to have a look around... you'll be surprised by how many dead links you won't find. There are still a few pages that have yet to roll out, but I'm not going to show them on the menu until they're 100% ready. Also, the new mod_rewrite structure might cause a few of the old blog links to not work, but I'll fix that shortly.

Sorry it took me so long to unveil the new design. Hopefully it was worth the wait. Send me your bugs, your huddled masses of design flaws, and your complaints. Either via e-mail or through the new suggestion page. Woo hoo!
author: Dan

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Look! The new comment system works too!

comments.author: Ben Dillon
comments.body: Snazzy!

comments.author: nathan springer
comments.body: amazing

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body: This better say "Where's my hat?" when I comment without an e-mail/URL! I love the new design. SO much easier to navigate. Great job Dan.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Uh oh. I better put the "Where's my hat?" back in...

comments.author: Derek
comments.body: I'm a fan. You definitely don't suck.

comments.author: Monkey
comments.body: Just FYI - asking people to click the ads is a big no-no with google. You should seriously take that down lest you be banned from adsense forever. This is no joke, they will delete accounts for this violation.

comments.author: Dave Adams
comments.body: I was about to say what Monkey said. Google is very strict about that.

comments.author: Grand Mof Tarkin
comments.body: Google's coming here?  We shall re-double our efforts.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: What about google ads?

comments.author: --Jeff
comments.body:
Woo Hoo! Site looks and behaves great. A perfectly executed rollout Dan and Nicole...

Thanks for the RSS feeds, as soon as Sage starts working better with Firefox 1.5.0.1, all will be well...

comments.author: Steve Croxton
comments.body: Oooooo...pretty....

comments.author: Andy
comments.body: The site isn't working in Firefox for me.  It's a big jumble.

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body:
i think i found an error....
... there hasnt been a photoblog since november...

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body:
on second thought.. the error might be that the 'photo tour' under misc. ... isnt also listed on the photo blog
or at least it coudl be counted as a photoblog.. to appease me

comments.author: --Jeff
comments.body:
The site isn't working in Firefox for me. It's a big jumble.

I ran into this problem during the "test phase" Andy. I cleared FF's cache, and it worked just fine after that...

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: The silly ads keep flickering for me.

comments.author: Monkey
comments.body:
Since when are the ads silly?

we rub some google on our skin our else we see the ads again

that's right, we love ads. no more nonsense about that subject. ;)

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Andy:: Jeff's right. You need to clear your cache.

Nicole:: You need to upgrade to FF 1.5

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body:
My mama says that Google ads are ornery because they got all them teeth and no toothbrush.

I use Firefox 5.0 Beta. It has rocket launchers and everything. Yeah, it's pretty sweet.
